tool_description:
Introducing our comprehensive 1001fx-APIs & ImageFunctions collection, a powerful suite of image manipulation tools designed to enhance your website's visual appeal and optimize your content for search engines. This collection includes a wide range of functionalities such as extracting EXIF data, applying various image transformations like blurring, sharpening, flipping, cropping, and resizing, as well as advanced image conversion and overlay capabilities.

Easily access our collection using ...
name: Image Functions 1001 APIs FX
title: Image Functions 1001 APIs FX

api_list.name: Blur Image
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://image-functions-1001-apis-fx.p.rapidapi.com/image/blur"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "image-functions-1001-apis-fx.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Overlaytwoimages
api_list.description: This endpoint takes two images to return a single overlayed image. **frontImageUrl** and **backimageUrl** must be specified in the request body. In addition, the following attributes might be used: - **position** (locates the front image in the specific position relative to the background image. Possible options are: 'center', 'top-left', 'top-right', 'bottom-left' and 'bottom-right' - **getAsUrl** (boolean value to determine if (true) the result image should be received in a url or as a buffer of an image (default)) - **options** - **verticalPosition** (difference of pixels between the upper side of both pictures) - **horizontalPosition** (difference of pixels between the left side of both pictures) - **opacity** (value between 1 (normal) and 0 (transparent) to modify the opacity of the front image) Front image in the example: Background image: Result:

api_list.name: Crop Image
api_list.description: This endpoint can be used to crop images. The image can be passed as a URL or Buffer. To receive the response in a URL, the `getAsUrl` attribute has to be set to `true`. The `options` attribute takes an object specifying `height` and `width` of the final image, and `top` and `left` coordinates where the cropping should start. Image in the example request: Image in the example response:

api_list.name: GetExifDataFromImageurl
api_list.description: "GetExifDataFromImageurl" is an API endpoint that allows users to retrieve EXIF (Exchangeable Image File Format) metadata from an image file specified by a URL. This endpoint can be integrated into applications or websites, allowing users to access the metadata programmatically. The returned data typically includes information such as the date and time the photo was taken, camera settings, and GPS coordinates of where the photo was taken. Developers can use this data to enhance the functionality of their applications or to provide additional context to their users.
api_list.code:

        }
